bibl.title: Mobility and Innovation in Hellenistic Economies: The Causes and Consequences of Human Traffic.
bibl.note: Analysing mobility and innovation. - Movements of military manpower. - Contemporary patterns of mobility: comparative issues. - A case study: the movement of artisans. - Incentives. - Innovation and social networks. - Conclusions.

bibl.title: The Economies of Hellenistic Societies, Third to First Centuries BC.

bibl.seg: ARCHIBALD Zosia H., Mobility and Innovation in Hellenistic Economies: The Causes and Consequences of Human Traffic.
Zosia H. ARCHIBALD, John K. DAVIES and Vincent GABRIELSEN (Edd.), The Economies of Hellenistic Societies, Third to First Centuries BC (Oxford, 2011) pp. 42-65.

Analysing mobility and innovation. - Movements of military manpower. - Contemporary patterns of mobility: comparative issues. - A case study: the movement of artisans. - Incentives. - Innovation and social networks. - Conclusions.
